content.description:
Start up a corner to gain the long ledge system on the main face. Traverse right across the ledge to a bolted anchor. It would be wise to belay here and climb the route in two pitches. From the bolted anchor move right to a steep ramp protected with two bolts.  You will see two old pins on the ramp. Delicate balancy climbing up the ramp to a ledge. Move right across the ledge and up to a slab where you will traverse right. From here move straight up through a corner then up and slightly left through overlaps all the way to the top and a bolted rappel station. 


at the left end of the long obvious ledge system. Climb the corner to get to the ledge.

5 bolts, a handful of cams from .3 to number 1 C4.

At the very left end of the cliff you'll encounter two alcoves. This route is just left of Split Decision in the right-most alcove. Climb up the face and slopey arête that leads to a horizontal crack. After the crack climb up the overhang using crimps. Finish on the same pine tree as Serpents volants. 

4 bolts and medium size cams bring's you to a tree anchor

A nice long pitch that wanders up the tall face.
Start in a corner. From its top step left and clip a bolt. Climb up and left past a flake then move back right, crossing a distinct square cutout. Climb up the short face to a roof and traverse left under the roof. Climb the left facing corner to the left of the roof and continue on easing terrain to the top.

On the main face there is a ledge system (Colt 45 traverses along this ledge). At its left end is a corner. That's the start of both Dog Fight and Colt 45.
9 bolts. a couple mid sized cams.

One of the rare jamming routes in the Welsford area. Climb the lightly overhanging hand sized crack to a ledge at 30ft. After the ledge, pull another short but easier crux and savor your victory by climbing the easier discontinuous cracks to the anchor.

On the left end of the cliff, look for a hand size crack. You can't miss it.
Cams and tape gloves. Bring at least two BD #2 and maybe two #1.

Burley start leads to a slab with a bolt. Pull the slab then make your way to a tree clipping another bolt along the way.

On the right end of the Main face, there is a spacious ledge with 4 mix routes. Climb the right-most route.
2 bolts and a few mid-size cams. Tree anchor

Climb the technical face past a few pockets and end at the large tree.

at the right end of the main face. Look for a short face with a few pockets.
3 bolts, tree anchor

climbs.name: Serpents Volants
climbs.fa: FA: M. Harnois  FFA: D.Caron, L. Gallant, M. Thériault

content.description:
Start on a horizontal crack and shift your weight over to a vertical. After a few moves you'll be under a mini-roof full of cracks just left of the arête. Pull it then head for the Pine tree. Really exposed for a short route!

At the very left end of the cliff you'll encounter two alcoves. This route is just right of Geocache in the left-most alcove.
single rack. Tree anchor for now

Climb the system of horizontal and vertical cracks in the corner and exit to the right of the roof. Continue up easier climbing to a bolted anchor.

Bring a rack. Micro cams help a lot. Bolted anchor.

A well protected mixed line with great movement and nice exposure. 



On the far left end of Sunset Ledge next to a huge White Pine tree. Start just left of the tree. It would be a good idea for the belayer to anchor off the Maple tree beside the Pine.  

Single rack to 2. 4 bolts. Bolted rap station.

A tough face start leads to the left end of the ledge. From the ledge clip the 5th bolt on your left and back-clean the 4th one to avoid rope drag. Climb sustained moves leading to a nice finger crack. After the crack ends, head left towards the anchor.

On the left end of the main cliff locate the route with black hangers right of Idoprofen.
6 bolts and gear up to 0.5 BD. The first bolt can be "stick-clipped" by simply holding on to the fixed nylon rope.

Climb the balancy start on a ramp angling left for a nice big flake. Clip the 5th bolt and commit to the crux. Continue up to a bolted anchor. 


From left to right, this is the 2nd route on the big ledge at the right end of big comfy ledge. 5' right of the massive Pine tree.

6 bolts and bolted anchor.

climbs.name: Wild Country
climbs.fa: Greg Hughes and Valerie Anctil, July 2022

content.description:
Start at the base of a slab that leads to a short hand crack. There are three possible variations to get to the hand crack - right, centre and left. The photo on this page shows the rightmost variation for the start. Climb up the crack and onto a huge ledge. Step right to a ramp protected with two bolts (shared section with Colt 45). Make delicate and balancy moves up the ramp to gain a ledge. Move up then left across a slab aiming for a bolt. Clip the bolt then move up to a series of overlaps following a weakness that leads to a final bit that goes straight up. Clip several bolts and place a few small cams along the way.  A long adventurous pitch. 



Where the approach trail meets the main part of the wall. Look for a slab slightly left that leads to a short hand crack. 


Single rack to #2. Gold offset nut, many long slings. You can easily rap back to the ground with a 70 meter rope.
This is the Main Face at Mount Douglas.
